info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 6:08PM MDT by NWS Missoula MT
info.description:
At 607 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 18 miles southeast of Bonner-West Riverside, or 20 miles west of Drummond, moving northeast at 35 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rainfall, frequent lightning, and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Flash flooding may occur near and below steep terrain. Ponding on roadways and low-lying areas is possible.
Locations impacted include... Deer Lodge, Drummond, Philipsburg, Ovando, Bonner-West Riverside, Garrison, Seeley Lake, Nimrod, Finn, Jens, Brock Creek, Potomac, Bearmouth, Quigley, Turah, Garnet, Helmville, Greenough, Maxville, and Princeton.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 109 and 180. Highway 12 Garrison to MacDonald Pass between mile markers 0 and 16. Highway 83 between mile markers 0 and 27. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 63.
info.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
